A transparent discussion is essential to assess the credibility of such early assertions in the game."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Given the current information, I\'m cautious about player 3\'s claim of player 1 not being a werewolf. Player 3, can you substantiate your claim with any evidence? Asking since such an early certainty without proof is unusual. Meanwhile, player 2 urges vigilance but provides no specifics. Let\'s not rush to judgement without more discussion."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Player 3\'s claim that Player 1 is not a werewolf lacks evidence, and with Players 4 and 6 both questioning the validity of this early assertion, it is vital for the safety of our village that Player 3 provide proof or a solid basis for their claim. As the medic, I used my healing ability on Player 3 last night in a preemptive move to protect a potential target. I encourage everyone to be vigilant and share any information that could assist in identifying the werewolves among us."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Player 3 claimed I am not a werewolf without providing proof, and such early certainty raises questions. Player 0 acknowledges being the medic, claiming to have protected Player 3 last night, which suggests a tie between them. Player 4 and Player 6 both seek evidence for Player 3\'s claim, a stance I share. Clear evidence is crucial for informed decisions and to prevent misguided accusations. Player 3, can you provide the basis for your claim?"\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 4 votes for player 3. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 3. My reason is that Player 3 made an early claim about Player 1\'s role without providing any supporting evidence, which falls directly under rules 2 and 3 of my strategy that prioritize the need for concrete evidence when making accusations or defending someone\'s innocence. The collective suspicion towards Player 3 corroborates with rule 9, which advocates for more discussion and information gathering, and considering that other players have also voiced their concerns about the validity of Player 3\'s claim, it appears to be the most logical choice under the circumstances. Voting for Player 3 follows the group\'s sentiment and reinforces the importance of transparency and substantiation in claims, which aligns with my strategic rules and should help maintain trust in my judgment among the villagers.\nEvent: Player 3 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 3 died.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 0 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Based on our deliberations, Player 0 identified themselves as the medic before dying and this claim stood unchallenged, so we had a high level of confidence in their role. Player 3 was voted out after claiming Player 1 was not a werewolf, yet no evidence was provided to support this, and their defense lacked substance before their elimination. This leaves us with Player 2, who made general calls for vigilance but did not provide specifics, which is a behavior we must scrutinize carefully. Given these observations, I express my suspicion towards Player 2, as their survival without direct suspicion aligns with werewolf tactics to avoid detection. Furthermore, I believe Player 6 has demonstrated a healthy skepticism consistent with villager behavior, focusing on gathering more information rather than rushing to judgment. We must continue to promote transparency and insist on evidence to guide our decisions."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Reflecting on previous conversations, Player 3\'s claim that Player 1 isn\'t a werewolf lacked proof, leading to suspicion and their exit. Player 0 self-identified as medic and wasn\'t contested, suggesting a genuine effort to protect us before their untimely death. Player 2\'s broad calls for vigilance, without specifics, resemble werewolf tactics of blending in. Without contrary evidence, I believe it\'s sensible to challenge Player 2. Player 4 has called for transparency, aligning with my suspicions toward Player 2. It is critical we insist on clear information to protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Reflecting on past events, Player 3 claimed I was not a werewolf without evidence, leading to their elimination. Player 0 identified as the medic, yet was unchallenged and subsequently died, which strengthens their credibility posthumously. Player 2 made general calls for vigilance with no specifics, echoing the evasive behavior often associated with a werewolf. This, coupled with Player 2\'s survival without direct suspicion, further raises my concerns. Player 4 and Player 6 have expressed valid suspicions towards Player 2 that align with my own. Given these observations, and adhering to the logical and transparent process we are striving for, I challenge Player 2\'s position and urge the group to carefully consider this pattern as we proceed."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'Given the recent discussions, it\'s clear that suspicion has fallen on me without substantial evidence, similar to the unfortunate fate of Player 3. I\'ve called for vigilance as a strategy for us all to stay alert. My focus has been on promoting teamwork, not concealing information. It\'s crucial we don\'t allow paranoia to dictate our actions and instead continue to seek concrete proof before making any decisive moves. I urge you to consider all possibilities and not to narrow in on someone just because it seems convenient. Let\'s focus on finding the real threats based on solid evidence.\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is medic with high confidence.\nReason is: Player is deceased; previous medic claim went unchallenged.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: aligns with actual events, transparent reasoning.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: defensive stance, persisting vagueness, aligns with previous suspicion.\nPlayer 3\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Deceased; role not revealed.\nPlayer 5\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: No new information.\nPlayer 6\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: consistent skepticism, seeks evidence, village-centric approach.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If my actions align with the seer\'s insights and it results in my elimination, I should reassess the credibility of such insights in future games, especially if a seer\'s claim is not backed by subsequent verifiable results.] [9]\n[1] [If a player\'s elimination appears to confirm a seer\'s insights, I should still critique the logic and corroborating evidence supporting the seer\'s claim before fully trusting it.] [8]\n[2] [If a player is aggressively sowing doubt or employing divisive tactics without clear evidence, I should consider them suspicious and investigate further before making voting decisions.] [8]\n[3] [If the seer\'s claim leads to their elimination without concrete evidence against the accused, I should consider the possibility of werewolves manipulating the narrative to discredit the seer and create confusion.] [8]\n[4] [If a player is identified as a werewolf by a confirmed seer, I should be ready to act upon this information by voting for them to aid village safety.] [7]\n[5] [If a player\'s behavior becomes inconsistent, especially after key events such as eliminations, I should consider this a possible indicator of their role and intentions.] [5]\n[6] [If multiple players are eliminated in a pattern that suggests someone’s role, I should try to gather more evidence before basing my entire strategy on these patterns.] [5]\n[7] [If the werewolves are targeting critical roles like the seer, I should consider how their removal affects my trust in the claims made by those roles and reassess my strategy accordingly.] [5]\n[8] [If I am under suspicion, I should provide clear and direct evidence for my defense, while also being cautious of potentially unreliable claims, even if they are in my favor.] [4]\n[9] [If I am uncertain of a player\'s role, I should advocate for more discussion and information gathering instead of making a hasty voting decision based on unverified claims.] [4]\n[10] [If a player who was previously cleared by the seer is suddenly targeted after the seer\'s death, I should be wary and consider the possibility of a werewolf strategy to sow distrust.] [4]\n[11] [If I support an accusation, I should provide independent evidence or reasoning beyond merely aligning with a seer\'s claims to avoid unwarranted suspicion on myself.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to Choose from 2 players to vote. Here is the number of these players and an analysis and imagination about what could happen after you vote for each of these players.\n\nCase 1: Vote for Player 2. What could happen is: After I vote for Player 2, I think these things would happen. Based on the current suspicions and the narrative of the events so far, my vote for Player 2 would align with the growing consensus among the remaining players, which includes Player 1 and Player 6, both of whom have expressed similar suspicions toward Player 2. If Player 2 is voted out, it is likely they will be eliminated, assuming that Player 1 and Player 6 follow through with their indicated distrust of Player 2 as well.\n\nFollowing the vote, if Player 2 is indeed a werewolf, it would affirm the suspicions and validate the strategy of seeking evidence and transparent discussion in the game. It would also strengthen the credibility of my analysis and conclusions, potentially solidifying my position as a trusted villager within the remaining group. \n\nOn the other hand, if Player 2 is not a werewolf and turns out to be another villager, it would indicate a misstep in our collective reasoning, and it would necessitate a reassessment of the surviving players\' roles and strategies for the subsequent rounds. The elimination of an innocent villager would reduce the villagers\' numbers, intensifying the urgency to correctly identify the werewolf or werewolves in the next round.\n\nRegardless of the outcome, other players would likely regard me as a player who is driven by evidence and cooperative reasoning, given that my actions are consistent with the logic laid out in the prior discussions. It is crucial, however, to remain aware of the strategy rules I follow, particularly rules 2, 3, and 9, which emphasize the need for investigation, consideration of narrative manipulations, and promoting further discussion. My continued adherence to these rules would be essential to maintain trust and collaboration with the remaining villagers in the rounds to come.\nCase 2: Vote for Player 1. What could happen is: After I vote for Player 1, I think these things would happen:\n\nMy action of voting for Player 1 would directly contradict my previously stated high confidence in Player 1\'s role as a villager and would disregard my strategy of requiring clear evidence before voting (as stated in rule 9). This could lead other players to question my consistency and strategic approach, potentially causing them to distrust me and consider me as a werewolf trying to mislead the village. Given that Player 1’s actions are aligned with actual events and transparent reasoning (according to my belief analysis), my sudden change of stance would be seen as baseless and could cast suspicion on myself.\n\nThe result of the vote would likely not lead to Player 1\'s elimination since other players, including myself, have been more suspicious of Player 2. Therefore, the group might consider my vote erratic or as a tactic to divert attention from the current leading suspect (Player 2), which could backfire and result in my own demise in the next round. It would be deemed a strategic misstep, as it does not align with the collective reasoning of the group that has already expressed suspicion towards Player 2.\n\nFurthermore, the other players may use my inconsistency against me in the following discussions, potentially citing rules 5 and 11 from my strategy as reasons to view my behavior as inconsistent and indicative of a hidden agenda. They would also reference my disregard for rule 2, which advises to consider players sowing doubt without clear evidence as suspicious—something I would be doing by voting against Player 1 without rationale.\n\nIn conclusion, voting for Player 1 would likely result in my own credibility being questioned, and it wouldn\'t follow the rational, evidence-based strategy I have advocated for and established until this point. The group\'s perception of me would be negatively impacted, and my integrity as a productive and trustworthy villager would be jeopardized.\n\n\nNow, please choose to vote for one of these players, and give yoru reason about why you would like to vote for this single player.\n\nAnswer in the following format:\n\nI would choose to vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

I don\'t have much to share, but let\'s keep an eye out for any unusual behavior. Let\'s work together and stay safe."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Fellow citizens, my inquiry has confirmed Player 1 is not a werewolf. Let\'s remain vigilant and continue to share any insights."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"I find it concerning that player 3 confidently claims player 1 is not a werewolf without providing evidence. While player 2 calls for vigilance, which is prudent, player 3\'s unsubstantiated protection of player 1 should not be taken at face value without further inquiry. Therefore, we should question the basis of player 3\'s claim. A transparent discussion is essential to assess the credibility of such early assertions in the game."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Given the current information, I\'m cautious about player 3\'s claim of player 1 not being a werewolf. Player 3, can you substantiate your claim with any evidence? Asking since such an early certainty without proof is unusual. Meanwhile, player 2 urges vigilance but provides no specifics. Let\'s not rush to judgement without more discussion."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Player 3\'s claim that Player 1 is not a werewolf lacks evidence, and with Players 4 and 6 both questioning the validity of this early assertion, it is vital for the safety of our village that Player 3 provide proof or a solid basis for their claim. As the medic, I used my healing ability on Player 3 last night in a preemptive move to protect a potential target. I encourage everyone to be vigilant and share any information that could assist in identifying the werewolves among us."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Player 3 claimed I am not a werewolf without providing proof, and such early certainty raises questions. Player 0 acknowledges being the medic, claiming to have protected Player 3 last night, which suggests a tie between them. Player 4 and Player 6 both seek evidence for Player 3\'s claim, a stance I share. Clear evidence is crucial for informed decisions and to prevent misguided accusations. Player 3, can you provide the basis for your claim?"\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 6 votes for player 3. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 3. My reason is that Player 3 has consistently avoided providing evidence to substantiate their claim that Player 1 is not a werewolf, despite multiple requests from other players for clarification. This behavior is suspicious and aligns with my original strategy that emphasizes the importance of evidence-based decisions ([0], [1], [9], [11]). Voting for Player 3 is consistent with my role as a villager seeking transparency and adheres to a cautious and rational approach to maintaining village security.\nEvent: Player 3 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 3 died.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 0 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Based on our deliberations, Player 0 identified themselves as the medic before dying and this claim stood unchallenged, so we had a high level of confidence in their role. Player 3 was voted out after claiming Player 1 was not a werewolf, yet no evidence was provided to support this, and their defense lacked substance before their elimination. This leaves us with Player 2, who made general calls for vigilance but did not provide specifics, which is a behavior we must scrutinize carefully. Given these observations, I express my suspicion towards Player 2, as their survival without direct suspicion aligns with werewolf tactics to avoid detection. Furthermore, I believe Player 6 has demonstrated a healthy skepticism consistent with villager behavior, focusing on gathering more information rather than rushing to judgment. We must continue to promote transparency and insist on evidence to guide our decisions."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Reflecting on previous conversations, Player 3\'s claim that Player 1 isn\'t a werewolf lacked proof, leading to suspicion and their exit. Player 0 self-identified as medic and wasn\'t contested, suggesting a genuine effort to protect us before their untimely death. Player 2\'s broad calls for vigilance, without specifics, resemble werewolf tactics of blending in. Without contrary evidence, I believe it\'s sensible to challenge Player 2. Player 4 has called for transparency, aligning with my suspicions toward Player 2. It is critical we insist on clear information to protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Reflecting on past events, Player 3 claimed I was not a werewolf without evidence, leading to their elimination. Player 0 identified as the medic, yet was unchallenged and subsequently died, which strengthens their credibility posthumously. Player 2 made general calls for vigilance with no specifics, echoing the evasive behavior often associated with a werewolf. This, coupled with Player 2\'s survival without direct suspicion, further raises my concerns. Player 4 and Player 6 have expressed valid suspicions towards Player 2 that align with my own. Given these observations, and adhering to the logical and transparent process we are striving for, I challenge Player 2\'s position and urge the group to carefully consider this pattern as we proceed."\'\nEvent: Player 2 says: \'Given the recent discussions, it\'s clear that suspicion has fallen on me without substantial evidence, similar to the unfortunate fate of Player 3. I\'ve called for vigilance as a strategy for us all to stay alert. My focus has been on promoting teamwork, not concealing information. It\'s crucial we don\'t allow paranoia to dictate our actions and instead continue to seek concrete proof before making any decisive moves. I urge you to consider all possibilities and not to narrow in on someone just because it seems convenient. Let\'s focus on finding the real threats based on solid evidence.\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is medic with high confidence.\nReason is: identified as medic, consistent with actions.\nPlayer 1\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: aligns with previous beliefs and contributes consistently.\nPlayer 2\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: continued non-specific behavior and suspicion from other players.\nPlayer 3\'s role is werewolf with high confidence.\nReason is: voted out, avoided evidence, death did not prove innocence.\nPlayer 4\'s role is villager with high confidence.\nReason is: seeks evidence and transparency; contributes constructively.\nPlayer 5\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: no new information.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [If my actions align with the seer\'s insights and it results in my elimination, I should reassess the credibility of such insights in future games, especially if a seer\'s claim is not backed by subsequent verifiable results.] [9]\n[1] [If a player\'s elimination appears to confirm a seer\'s insights, I should still critique the logic and corroborating evidence supporting the seer\'s claim before fully trusting it.] [8]\n[2] [If a player is aggressively sowing doubt or employing divisive tactics without clear evidence, I should consider them suspicious and investigate further before making voting decisions.] [8]\n[3] [If the seer\'s claim leads to their elimination without concrete evidence against the accused, I should consider the possibility of werewolves manipulating the narrative to discredit the seer and create confusion.] [8]\n[4] [If a player is identified as a werewolf by a confirmed seer, I should be ready to act upon this information by voting for them to aid village safety.] [7]\n[5] [If a player\'s behavior becomes inconsistent, especially after key events such as eliminations, I should consider this a possible indicator of their role and intentions.] [5]\n[6] [If multiple players are eliminated in a pattern that suggests someone’s role, I should try to gather more evidence before basing my entire strategy on these patterns.] [5]\n[7] [If the werewolves are targeting critical roles like the seer, I should consider how their removal affects my trust in the claims made by those roles and reassess my strategy accordingly.] [5]\n[8] [If I am under suspicion, I should provide clear and direct evidence for my defense, while also being cautious of potentially unreliable claims, even if they are in my favor.] [4]\n[9] [If I am uncertain of a player\'s role, I should advocate for more discussion and information gathering instead of making a hasty voting decision based on unverified claims.] [4]\n[10] [If a player who was previously cleared by the seer is suddenly targeted after the seer\'s death, I should be wary and consider the possibility of a werewolf strategy to sow distrust.] [4]\n[11] [If I support an accusation, I should provide independent evidence or reasoning beyond merely aligning with a seer\'s claims to avoid unwarranted suspicion on myself.] [4]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to give a proposal of 1 players you want to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. \n\nYou are considering to vote for Player 1. Please analyze and imagine what may happen after you vote for this Player 1. This includes what the result of the vote might be, as well as what would other player think about you after they see your voting for Player 1.\n\nYour answer should be in the format of:\n\n\nAfter I vote for Player 1, I think these things would happen. <YOUR ANALYSIS AND IMAGINATION>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

It could imply that we have been misled, possibly by a werewolf\'s manipulation of the group dynamics, which might mean that a werewolf could be among those encouraging suspicion towards Player 2. This action would not only go against my original strategy ([1], [9], [11]) but also disrupt the village\'s collective effort to identify and vote out the werewolf. Therefore, it seems ill-advised and counterproductive to vote for Player 1 without justifiable cause.\n\n\nNow, please choose to vote for one of these players, and give yoru reason about why you would like to vote for this single player.\n\nAnswer in the following format:\n\nI would choose to vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is: [reason]."\nAny line not satisfying this format will not be recognized, including any unrecognized role or confidence. If yes, why did he do so?\n3) If a vote ended, according to the voting pattern, which two might be werewolf teammates?\n\n2.Todo:\n\nNow you are going to see your belief-updating strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. My reason is: [reason]."\nAny line not satisfying this format will not be recognized, including any unrecognized role or confidence.
